OPM-2025-0004-2824 2025-06-28
Opposition to Politicization of the Civil Service/Schedule F Opposition to Weakening Federal Due Process and Worker Protections (General Civil Service Rights)
 None This is an unconstitutional and ridiculous ruling. YOU are the ones who are weaponizing the civil service and hiring people with a loyalty litmus test. You are certainly not interested in hiring people based on meritocracy! The civil service should be nonpartisan and we need to retain their decades... 1 1:1 The civil service should be nonpartisan and we need to retain their decades of expertise from administration to administration. The commenter expresses clear opposition to the politicization of the civil service, emphasizing the need for a nonpartisan workforce and the retention of expertise. Additionally, their reference to the unconstitutional nature of the ruling implies a concern for the erosion of due process and worker protections, aligning with the identified stances.
OPM-2025-0004-17882 2025-06-28
Opposition to Politicization of the Civil Service/Schedule F Opposition to Weakening Federal Due Process and Worker Protections (General Civil Service Rights)
 None I write in opposition to the rule proposed by the Personnel Management Office on 04/23/25 titled "Improving Performance, Accountability and Responsiveness in the Civil Service" (Office of Personnel Management 5 CFR Parts 210, 212, 213, 302, 432, 451, and 752 [Docket ID: OPM-2025-0004] RIN 3206-AO80)... 1 1:1 A system where only loyalty is rewarded and where all employees serve 'at will' is much worse for employees and the country. The comment clearly opposes the proposed rule by emphasizing the importance of merit-based hiring and advancement, linking it to the Pendleton Act. It warns against a politicized and at-will employment system that undermines fairness and competence in the federal workforce, thus demonstrating opposition to both politicization and the weakening of worker protections.
OPM-2025-0004-0656 2025-06-28 None None Re: Procedural Deficiencies in Rescinding the April 2024 Final Rule I am writing to highlight significant administrative law deficiencies in this NPRM's approach to rescinding the April 2024 final rule. I. Failure to Satisfy State Farm Requirements This NPRM violates principles established in Motor ... 1 1:1 Properly promulgated regulations have the force of law and cannot be nullified by executive order alone. The comment focuses on procedural and administrative law concerns regarding the NPRM's adherence to legal requirements rather than expressing a stance regarding the politicization of the civil service, federal employee protections, or executive authority. Therefore, it does not align with any of the existing stances.

Opposition to Politicization of the Civil Service/Schedule F Opposition to Weakening Federal Due Process and Worker Protections (General Civil Service Rights)

Making more employees "at will" employees that will allow a President to fire them arbitrarily. This will support employees who disagree with the President when they feel an action may be illega... 1 1:1 I am opposed to new regulations that would revive Schedule F as it will politicize personnel decisions. The commenter clearly opposes the implementation of Schedule F, highlighting concerns about the politicization of personnel decisions and the potential for arbitrary firings. Additionally, they express worries about due process and the quality of hires under an at-will system, which aligns with the stance on worker protections.

Opposition to Politicization of the Civil Service/Schedule F Opposition to Political Interference in Scientific and Grantmaking Roles

As a scientist and a member of the American Society for Microbiology, I write to express my concerns with the OPM‚Äôs proposal ... 1 1:1 This proposal undermines the scientific credibility of career professionals and will have a chilling impact on scientific integrity within the federal government. The commenter expresses clear opposition to the proposed rule due to concerns about its impact on the integrity of scientific positions and the potential politicization of federal employees, emphasizing the importance of non-partisan scientific work and the loss of institutional knowledge.

They are part of what has made the USA a leader in policy, science, technology and public service. Any attempt to "put... 1 1:1 An attack on the civil service is an attack on the USA and does the work of our enemies. The commenter expresses strong opposition to efforts that would undermine the status and protections of federal civil servants, highlighting the importance of their work and framing any attack on the civil service as detrimental to the United States itself. This aligns with the stances opposing politicization and the weakening of worker protections in the civil service.
OPM-2025-0004-21177 2025-06-28
Opposition to Political Interference in Scientific and Grantmaking Roles Opposition to Politicization of the Civil Service/Schedule F
 None Decisions to fund scientific research based on objective review processes by Federal agencies and institutes such as the NIH and NSF without political interference in place for decades have been highly successful in generating discoveries that have resulted in new treatments and cures. This new regu... 1 1:1 This proposed new regulation would inject political interference into the research grant assessment and award process and destroy the scientific integrity of the federal grant award process. The comment explicitly warns against the potential politicization of NIH and NSF roles, asserting that it would jeopardize scientific integrity and disrupt successful research processes. These positions directly oppose the proposed changes, emphasizing the need for non-partisan oversight in scientific funding and decision-making.
